thread.title: Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel, Comcast and Project HOME Team Up to Host Hunt.Fi
thread.title_full: Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel, Comcast and Project HOME Team Up to Host Hunt.Fi

author: Michelle Scheuermann
title: Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel, Comcast and Project HOME Team Up to Host Hunt.Fi
text:
Sportsman Channel, Outdoor Channel, Comcast and Project HOME Team Up to Host Hunt.Fi Posted on by Michelle Scheuermann Outdoor Sportsman Group – Integrated Media 
DENVER – ( Ammoland.Com ) – Sportsman Channel , Outdoor Channel , Comcast and Project HOME are teaming up to host a Hunt.Fish.Feed event in Philadelphia on Wednesday, October 14 and Thursday, October 15 , serving a special venison burger meal to Philadelphians in need at three Project HOME resident locations. Special guest Scott Leysath, Sportsman Channel TV host and Executive Chef, will help prepare and serve venison burgers with fries or onion rings, fruit and dessert. 
Hunt.Fish.Feed., created by Sportsman Channel, is a unique outreach program that taps an underutilized food source—game meat and fish donated by sportsmen—to feed those struggling with hunger across America. Philadelphia’s event will utilize more than 75 lbs of venison donated by Realtree Outdoors. 
“Hunt.Fish.Feed. is an opportunity for hunters and fishermen to share the bounty of their good fortune,” said CEO and President of Outdoor Sportsman Group, Jim Liberatore . “This program is very important to our organization and helps us refocus on what’s really important. We are especially grateful that partners like Comcast understand and share our vision when it comes to Hunt.Fish.Feed.” 
”We are honored to be part of this creative and unique effort to help provide meals for Project HOME,” said Kathleen Sullivan, Comcast vice president of government affairs . “Projects like Hunt.Fish.Feed. demonstrate there are ways for us all to lend a hand and help people get their lives back on track.” 
Wednesday, October 14 (one location) 
Project HOME’s Women of Change Residence 
A safe haven for 25 chronically homeless women with serious mental illness or addiction problems 
2042 Arch Street 
Serving dinner at 5:30 p.m. 
Thursday, October 15 (two locations) 
Project HOME’S St. Columbia Residence 
A safe haven for 40+ chronically homeless men with serious mental illness or addiction problems 
4133-9 Chestnut Street 
Serving Lunch at 11:30 a.m. 

Project HOME’S Karios House 
Transitional housing with 36 units for men and women with serious mental illness 
1440 North Broad Street 
Philadelphia, PA 19121 
Serving dinner at 5:30 p.m. 
“It takes an entire community to break the cycle of homelessness and poverty. This donation illustrates that there are many ways to be involved and make a difference,” said S. Mary Scallion, president and executive director for Project HOME . 
Project HOME stands for Housing, Opportunities for Employment, Medical Care, and Education. The mission of the Project HOME community is to empower adults, children, and families to break the cycle of homelessness and poverty, to alleviate the underlying causes of poverty, and to enable all of us to attain our fullest potential as individuals and as members of the broader society. We strive to create a safe and respectful environment where we support each other in our struggles for self-esteem, recovery, and the confidence to move toward self-actualization. Learn more at http://projecthome.org 
Join the conversation about Hunt.Fish.Feed. online at http://facebook.com/huntfishfeed 
About Outdoor Sportsman Group 
Outdoor Sportsman Group is comprised of the world’s foremost media and entertainment brands for outdoor adventure enthusiasts. It includes three leading multichannel networks: Outdoor Channel, Sportsman Channel and World Fishing Network. The Group also consists of a number of established integrated media assets: 15 outdoor magazines, such as Guns & Ammo, Petersen’s Bowhunting and Florida Sportsman , and 17 top websites, including BassFan.com. Additionally, Outdoor Sportsman Group includes television production operations, Winnercomm, as well as aerial camera businesses, SkyCam and CableCam.
